data.title: Food and Beer Choices were very Good
data.text: Stopped in this place after the football game.  Very nice.  Guinness was poured correctly and was at the right temperature.  My friends and I ordered various items for a later dinner and everyone seemed happy.  I had a three cheese grilled cheese with bacon that was very good.   Followed dinner with a Powers on the rocks and it made the visit most excellent.

owner_response.author: Terry L, Owner at Finnegan's Wake Irish Pub, responded to this review
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great sports bar
data.text: The bar tender is so attentive and nice. They have game day specials. The wings are really good. But the cheese curds are amazing. All of their bathrooms are unisex, and have changing tables, so it's kid friendly too!

owner_response.author: Terry L, Owner at Finnegan's Wake Irish Pub, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks Kedmond ! Pats fan I believe and thanks again....
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great pub!
data.text: For those that frequent Irish bars/pubs, you know a good one when you find it.  Finnegan's Wake pours a perfect pint of Guinness and they have gone to great lengths to make sure the Guinness tastes "right."  The food is fantastic and the service was spot on.  Yes, there are TVs here, but just the right amount and they are not overwhelming.  This is NOT a sports bar, but it's an Irish pub in which you can watch sports.  Great size, nice atmosphere.  Next time you're in Rockville, go!

owner_response.author: Terry L, Owner at Finnegan's Wake Irish Pub, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you very much Matt W ! Not many Pubs left without a TV, thanks again and looking forward to your return.
Terry
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice bar in town center
data.text: This is a comfortable place to go for a drink and some good food.  We've had a few of the food selections - lamb sliders, grilled cheese, chopped salad and burgers to name a few - and all have been good!  This is a nice cozy neighborhood place - something Rockville needed.  We are happy to return and will do often.

data.title: Guinness and Poutine, Together Again!
data.text: This is a new entry to the ever-increasing Rockville Town Centre scene: While there is no identity with an actual Irish Pub, there is a coziness to this one room venue. There is a large bar, a communal table in the middle and several tables scattered about. The lack of natural light exudes some intimacy. There is a full bar along with a nice compliment of whiskey - and there is the Guinness, and a perfectly poured pint with the correct temperature, body and balance.The menu is rather eccelctic in that it offers some unusual entries =, such as poutine, which is a Quebec appetizer consisting of French fries and cheese curds drenched in gravy. I enjoyed the corned beef sandwich that was thick and rich and different from the usual fare one would find at other sports pubs - posing as Irish pubs.  All in all, a great place to enjoy a few drinks, a filling meal and live music (on certain nights).

data.title: A Wake is a Funeral - that's what this place needs
data.text: Putting an Irish name on your sign does not make you an Irish Pub.  This place has confused itself with a low level sports bar.  If you just want bar food and beer, it's probably ok.  They seem to have a large selection of beers. We dropped in for dinner.  Despite heavy signage outside that they serve wine, the selection was horrible.  I decided to order a cider, but they were out.  My husband ordered bangers and mash, which were pretty tasty.  My meal was terrible.  There is no Irish atmosphere to be found and the majority of food items on the menu were distinctively non-Irish food.  We won't be returning.

owner_response.author: Terry L, Owner at Finnegan's Wake Irish Pub, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Cindy M, we have the absolute best Pint of Guinness in the area, along with the best staff from Ireland, South Boston and likewise tending to the clientele. The Cráic at the "Wake" is remarkable. We do NOT have a large selection of beers, nor do we cater to anyone that is an aficionado of wines, simply not what we do. We know that the Bangers are excellent and we find it somewhat peculiar that you did not cite what entrée you had that was terrible. Lastly, we built and decorated THE WAKE specifically for the IRISH, not the typical American Tourist, hence why you simply didn't get it. The best compliment we can receive is from an Irish Citizen. If you were looking for a Shamrock or Leprachon, try the usual Cliché place but remember that we are far more Authentic than you'll ever know.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

user_location.name: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

data.title: Cozy new bar in Town Center
data.text: There are three TV screens, two over the bar and on a side wall, but this place isn't a sports bar.  This is a neighborhood bar!  The overall space is not large, but the actual bar is a good-size, and takes up about a fourth of the floor space, with the rest being tables and chairs-- no booths. The first time we went, it had just opened, and they had a limited menu of a few entrees and sides written on the chalk board. The menu has expanded and is now printed, with several entrees, some sandwiches, and salads, including dinner salads. It's still mostly pub food, but after all, it's a pub! I had the flank steak with brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes. It was pretty tasty, and the brussel sprouts were mostly well cooked instead of being "al dente" (which I hate). A couple were a little too crunchy for me, but they gave you so many it didn't matter. They have a nice long beer list, including a lot of local beers, which my husband liked. We went early, and the bar was already packed, but there were plenty of open tables.

data.title: Perfect Pint
data.text: Had a PERFECT pint and some AWESOME lamb sliders for lunch.  A GREAT addition to Rockville Town Center.  Not just another chain restaurant.

owner_response.author: Terry L, Owner at Finnegan's Wake Irish Pub, responded to this review
